Crypto Hogwarts ‚ö°ü•∑( üíú , üèîÔ∏è )

@HogwartsCrypto
View on X

Solana‚Äôs next 20x isn‚Äôt another memecoin. It‚Äôs a working product with a founder who already won. $BEAR. When I bet early, I bet on the person behind it. And $BEAR has @alfie_arnaud - a beast. üß† - Built 8-fig biz. $1.3M ARR. - Berkeley dev. - Bootstrapped SaaS before most finished high school. Now he‚Äôs all in on @vabearapp. And I‚Äôm all in on $BEAR. üêª üìà $BEAR is real biz: ‚Ä¢ $10K+ MRR ‚Ä¢ 5,000+ VAs ‚Ä¢ SaaS model w/ recurring rev ‚Ä¢ Tokenomics flywheel ‚Ä¢ Fully fiat + BEAR token integration üß† Solves a huge problem for founders: ‚Ä¢ Admin overload ‚Ä¢ Calendar chaos ‚Ä¢ Missed leads VA Bear = Hire, manage & pay ‚Äî all in one dashboard. Zero friction. üí∞Token = key layer ‚Ä¢ Fixed supply (SOL) ‚Ä¢ Discounts + rewards ‚Ä¢ Buybacks from fees ‚Ä¢ VAs already have BEAR wallets The loop: ‚Üí Usage ‚Üí Revenue ‚Üí Buybacks ‚Üí üöÄ This isn‚Äôt vaporware. It‚Äôs a company. Live. Registered. Growing. ‚Ä¢ $10K+ MRR ‚Ä¢ 3 new enterprise clients just last week ‚Ä¢ $3.6K more MRR added ‚Ä¢ Team of 10 ‚Ä¢ New landing + demo soon $BEAR at $300K mcap? Feels criminally undervalued. Just wait until the flywheel kicks in. This is how 20‚Äì30x starts. Don't fade the founder. Don't miss the moment. LFG!

DEFI Kadic

@defikadic
View on X

Love this line: ‚ÄúAI is where SaaS was 20 years ago.‚Äù The real unlock isn‚Äôt just more powerful models - but agents trained on user-owned, verifiable IP. The horizontal-to-vertical SaaS shift is repeating in AI. Expect billion-dollar moats to be built on domain-specific data. And you know what, that vision is strongly powered by @campnetworkxyz.

James Chi ‚õ∫

@jameskchi
View on X

AI is where SaaS was 20 years ago. General-purpose models are everywhere - fast-improving, widely used, but trained on largely the same data, which limits how differentiated their outputs can be. Model power keeps improving, but what‚Äôs missing is the ability to anchor agents in unique, user-owned, verifiable IP. We‚Äôve watched this play out before in SaaS. Horizontal software won the early game - capturing broad demand, hitting PMF across industries, and scaling fast. But over time, vertical players carved out massive businesses by going deep: not just embedding domain-specific workflows, but aligning with industry-specific standards, regulatory constraints, and proprietary data environments. Look at Veeva ($45B+) vs. Salesforce, Toast ($25B+) vs. Micros, CoStar ($35B+) vs. Excel & Microsoft Dynamics. Each built defensibility by solving problems horizontal tools couldn‚Äôt touch. The same playbook is unfolding in AI. The shift happens when agents are trained on user-owned IP - data that‚Äôs proprietary and verifiable by provenance. That‚Äôs when vertical moats emerge and where the next wave of value creation will happen. We‚Äôre excited to launch Origin (for IP tokenization) and mAItrix (our AI agent framework) - two protocols that let users remix Camp‚Äôs proprietary Trailheads IP using AI, and tokenize their creations onchain as original or derivative works. The design space for co-creation and monetization on Camp is massive. Camp with us ‚õ∫Ô∏è

Caldera the AWS of crypto? The @Calderaxyz ecosystem is accelerating, they have already built a strong solid SaaS foundation of foundations paying a monthly subscription fee to secure their network on Caldera. With this revenue, they will not have to sell $ERA tokens to fund operations and they can get the actual token flywheel all projects are trying to get. They can use the tokens to acquire users & teams to launch and build on Caldera. This is the only real sustainable way to grow an ecosystem.

You built a SaaS platform like Figma, but the third-party plugin ecosystem is failing. Plugins are insecure, consume too many resources, and frequently crash the main application for users. The platform is now unstable, and developer trust is eroding. How do you fix this?
